data.text: Again, one preparing to sail, and about to journey over raging waves,
For that vessel  the hunger for gains devised,
And thy providence, O Father, guideth it along,
Shewing that thou canst save out of every danger,
And it is thy will that the works of thy wisdom should be not idle;

For blessed Or, is  hath been wood through which cometh righteousness:
But the idol  made with hands is accursed, itself and he that made it;
For both the ungodly doer and his ungodliness are alike hateful to God;
For verily the deed shall be punished together with him that committed it.
Therefore also Or, upon Gr. in.  among the idols of the nations shall there be a visitation,
For the devising of idols was the beginning of fornication,
For neither were they from the beginning, neither shall they be for ever;
For by the vaingloriousness of men they entered into the world,
For a father worn with untimely grief,
Afterward the ungodly custom, in process of time grown strong, was kept as a law,
And when men could not honour them in presence because they dwelt far off,
But unto a yet higher pitch was worship raised even by them that knew him  not,
For he, wishing peradventure to please one in authority,
And the multitude, allured by reason of the grace of his handywork,
And this became Gr. an ambush.  a hidden danger unto life,
Afterward it was not enough for them to go astray as touching the knowledge of God;
For either slaughtering children in solemn rites, or celebrating secret mysteries,
No longer do they Or, keep unstained either life or marriage  guard either life or purity of marriage,
